results.title: Electricity and movement
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description: The basic principles of the electric motor. Opens with an account of the properties of magnets. Compares the action of permanent magnets and electro-magnets. An electro-magnet is used to work an electric bell. An electro-magnet is then adapted so that it turns on an axle and, in this way, the development of a simple electric motor is demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park

results.title: Electricity and light
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description: Explains how electrical energy is transformed into light by three methods - the filament lamp, the arc lamp, and the discharge tube. The film considers each type detail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park

results.title: Electricity and heat
results.creator_credit: Langton Gould-Marks, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description: The heating effect of an electric current is shown to be a clue to agitation of the aubital electrons; the difference between series and modern applications of electric heating are demonstrated.

results.title: Electricity
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Addresses the fundamentals of electrostatics and current electricity, helping students to form images of abstract concepts. The first three programs on electrostatics explains the charging of objects by contact and induction. The last three episodes on current electricity looks at electrical charge, current flow, potentail difference and resistance.

results.title: Electrical safety in the workplace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at the effects and potential hazards associated with electricity, including definitions of basic terms, facts about how electricity is conducted and the effects of electrical currents on the human body. It identifies common hazards found in the workplace including overhead power lines, damp locations and the use of extension cords, as well as the importance of insulation and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment. Presented by Peter Mitchell.

results.title: Electric sound
results.brief_description: The wave of electric sound from the 40s onwards transformed not just how people watched movies and how they identified genre, but how they listened to it as well. The otherworldly chords of the theremin became indelibly linked to science fiction.

constellations_primary.name: Electric sound supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_primary.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

results.description: Specific types of movies have a specific sound. Overtime, these associations inevitably become subconscious. The wave of electric sound from the 40s onwards transformed not just how people watched movies and how they identified genre, but how they listened to it as well. The otherworldly chords of the theremin became indelibly linked to science fiction, while husband and wife composers Bebe and Louis Barron are credited with creating the first fully realised electronic film score for 50s cult classic Forbidden Planet (1956). From deploying unconventional instruments to early looping and splicing techniques, the legacy of electric sound can still be found today in the works of composers like Danny Elfman.
description_for_label: Specific types of movies have a specific sound. Overtime, these associations inevitably become subconscious. The wave of electric sound from the 40s onwards transformed not just how people watched movies and how they identified genre, but how they listened to it as well. The otherworldly chords of the theremin became indelibly linked to science fiction, while husband and wife composers Bebe and Louis Barron are credited with creating the first fully realised electronic film score for 50s cult classic Forbidden Planet (1956). From deploying unconventional instruments to early looping and splicing techniques, the legacy of electric sound can still be found today in the works of composers like Danny Elfman.

results.title: Electric furnaces
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, British Iron and Steel Federation and Merton Park
results.brief_description: Steels for certain special purposes are made in furnaces heated by electricity. This film explains the construction and working of the electric arc and high frequency induction furnaces. Animated diagrams are used to illustrate the chemical reactions in the arc furnace and the principles of induction heating.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare, British Iron and Steel Federation and Merton Park

results.title: Electric flag
results.brief_description: About the crucial role television and film play in the running of a political campaign. Covers both the making of a candidate and the making of the film “The Candidate”. Points out that in a campaign ‘the general idea is to project energy, warmth, and decisiveness, without saying anything too specific’. Suitable for upper secondary level.
